original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: saṃnyāsaṃ karmaṇāṃ kṛṣṇa punar yogaṃ ca śaṃsasi /
analyzed: saṃnyāsam karmaṇām kṛṣṇa punar yogam ca śaṃsasi
translated: O Krsna, you recommend renunciation of actions and also yoga.

original: yac chreya etayor ekaṃ tan me brūhi suniścitam ////
analyzed: yat śreyaḥ etayoḥ ekam tat me brūhi su niścitam
translated: Tell me definitely which one of these two is better.

original: śrīdharaḥ /
translated: Sridhara.

original: nivārya saṃśayaṃ jiṣṇoḥ karmasaṃnyāsayogayoḥ /
analyzed: nivārya saṃśayam jiṣṇoḥ karma saṃnyāsa yogayoḥ
translated: Having removed Arjuna's doubt regarding renunciation of actions and yoga,

original: jitendriyasya ca yateḥ pañcame muktim abravīt //
analyzed: jita indriyasya ca yateḥ pañcame muktim abravīt
translated: he spoke of liberation in the fifth chapter for the self-controlled and disciplined one.

original: ajñānasambhūtaṃ saṃśayaṃ jñānāsinā chittvā karmayogam ātiṣṭha ity uktam /
analyzed: ajñāna sambhūtam saṃśayam jñāna asinā chittvā karma yogam ātiṣṭhe iti uktam
translated: It was said, Having cut off doubt born of ignorance with the sword of knowledge, engage in the yoga of action.

original: tatra pūrvāparavirodhaṃ manvāno 'rjuna uvāca saṃnyāsam iti /
analyzed: tatra pūrva apara virodham manvānaḥ rjunaḥ uvāca saṃnyāsam iti
translated: Thinking of contradiction between the earlier and later statements, Arjuna said, Renunciation, etc.

original: yas tv ātmaratir eva syād ity ādinā sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ pārtha ity ādinā ca karmasaṃnyāsaṃ kathayasi /
analyzed: yaḥ tu ātma ratiḥ eva syāt iti ādinā sarvam karma akhilam pārthaḥ iti ādinā ca karma saṃnyāsam kathayasi
translated: You speak of renunciation of all actions by But one who is delighted in the Self alone, etc. and by All this entire action, O son of Prtha, etc.

original: jñānāsinā saṃśayaṃ chittvā yogam ātiṣṭha iti punar yogaṃ ca kathayasi /
analyzed: jñāna asinā saṃśayam chittvā yogam ātiṣṭhe iti punar yogam ca kathayasi
translated: And again you speak of yoga by Having cut off doubt with the sword of knowledge, engage in yoga.

original: na ca karmasaṃnyāsaḥ karmayogaś ca ekasyaiva ekadaiva sambhavataḥ viruddhasvarūpatvāt /
analyzed: na ca karma saṃnyāsaḥ karma yogaḥ ca ekasya eva ekadā eva sambhavataḥ viruddha svarūpa tvāt
translated: And renunciation of actions and yoga of action cannot exist for the same person at the same time, because of their contradictory natures.

original: tasmād etayor madhya ekasminn anuṣṭhātavye sati mama yac chreyaḥ suniścitam tad ekaṃ brūhi ////
analyzed: tasmāt etayoḥ madhye ekasmin anuṣṭhātavye sati mama yat śreyaḥ su niścitam tat ekam brūhi
translated: Therefore, when one has to perform one of these two, tell me which one is certainly better for me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: adhyāyābhyāṃ kṛto dvābhyāṃ nirṇayaḥ karmabodhayoḥ /
analyzed: adhyāyābhyām kṛtaḥ dvābhyām nirṇayaḥ karma bodhayoḥ
translated: The determination of the meanings of action and knowledge has been made in two chapters.

original: karmatattyāgayor dvābhyāṃ nirṇayaḥ kriyate 'dhunā //🔽tṛtīye 'dhyāye jyāyasī cet karmaṇas te ity ādinārjunena pṛṣṭo bhagavān jñānakarmaṇor🔽vikalpasamuccayāsambhavenādhikāribhedavyavasthayā loke 'smin dvividhā niṣṭhā purā
analyzed: karma tad tyāgayoḥ dvābhyām nirṇayaḥ kriyate dhunā  tṛtīye dhyāye jyāyasī ced karmaṇaḥ te iti ādinā arjunena pṛṣṭaḥ bhagavān jñāna karmaṇoḥ  vikalpa samuccaya asambhavena adhikāri bheda vyavasthayā loke smin dvividhā niṣṭhā purā
translated: Now the determination of action and its renunciation is made in two chapters.

original: proktā mayānagha ity ādinā nirṇayaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: proktāḥ mayā anaghaḥ iti ādinā nirṇayam kṛtavān
translated: In the third chapter, when asked by Arjuna with the words If it is better than action... etc., the Lord made a determination with the words In this world, O sinless one, two kinds of devotion have been declared by Me before... etc., by establishing a distinction in eligibility due to the impossibility of the option and combination of knowledge and action.

original: tathā cājñādhikārikaṃ karma na jñānena saha samuccīyate tejastimirayor iva yugapad asambhavāt karmādhikārahetubhedabuddhyapanodakatvena
analyzed: tathā ca ajñā ādhikārikam karma na jñānena saha samuccīyate tejaḥ timirayoḥ iva yugapad asambhavāt karma adhikāra hetu bheda buddhi apanodaka tvena
translated: And ritual action pertaining to the ignorant is not combined with knowledge, because of the impossibility of light and darkness together, and because knowledge, by removing the notion of difference in the cause of eligibility for action,

original: jñānasya tadvirodhitvāt /
analyzed: jñānasya tad virodhi tvāt
translated: is opposed to that.

original: nāpi vikalpyate ekārthatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: na api vikalpyate eka artha tva abhāvāt
translated: Nor is it optionally performed, because there is no single purpose.

original: jñānakāryasyājñānanāśasya karmaṇā kartum aśakyatvāt tam eva viditvāpi mṛtyum eti nānyaḥ panthā vidyate 'nāyanāya iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: jñāna kāryasya ajñāna nāśasya karmaṇā kartum aśakya tvāt tam eva viditvā api mṛtyum eti na anyaḥ panthāḥ vidyate na ayanāya iti śruteḥ
translated: Because the effect of knowledge, the destruction of ignorance, cannot be brought about by action, therefore, even though one may know that death, one goes by that (path of action) alone; there is no other path for going (to the goal).

original: jñāne jāte tu karmakāryaṃ nāpekṣyata evety uktaṃ yāvān artha udapāne ity atra /
analyzed: jñāne jāte tu karma kāryam na apekṣyate eva iti uktam yāvān arthaḥ udapāne iti atra
translated: But when knowledge has arisen, the effect of action is not at all required; this has been stated in the passage beginning with, As much as one desires to obtain from water...

original: tathā ca jñāninaḥ karmānadhikāre niścite prārabdhakarmavaśād vṛthāceṣṭārūpeṇa tadanuṣṭhānaṃ vā sarvakarmasaṃnyāso veti nirvivādaṃ caturthe 🔽nirṇītam /
analyzed: tathā ca jñāninaḥ karma anadhikāre niścite prārabdha karma vaśāt vṛthā ceṣṭā rūpeṇa tad anuṣṭhānam vā sarva karma saṃnyāsaḥ vā iti nirvivādam caturthe  nirṇītam
translated: And thus, when it is certain that the man of knowledge is not entitled to action, the performance of action in the form of useless activity by the power of the prārabdha karma, or the renunciation of all action, is undisputed and has been settled in the fourth (chapter).🔽But by the ignorant, actions are to be performed through the purification of the internal organ for the arising of knowledge, as stated in the śruti,

original: ajñena tv antaḥkaraṇaśuddhidvārā jñānotpattaye karmāṇy anuṣṭheyāni tam etaṃ vedānuvacanena brāhmaṇā vividiṣanti yajñena dānena tapasānāśakena 🔽iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: ajñena tu antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi dvārā jñāna utpattaye karmāṇi anuṣṭheyāni tam etam veda anuvacanena brāhmaṇāḥ vividiṣanti yajñena dānena tapasā anāśakena  iti śruteḥ
translated: The brāhmaṇas seek to know Him through the study of the Vedas, through sacrifice, through charity, through austerity, through the performance of difficult tasks...

original: sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate iti bhagavadvacanāc ca /
analyzed: sarvam karma akhilam pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate iti bhagavat vacanāt ca
translated: And also from the words of the Lord, All action, O son of Pṛthā, is concluded in knowledge.

original: evaṃ sarvakarmāṇi jñānārthāni /
analyzed: evam sarva karmāṇi jñāna arthāni
translated: Thus all actions are for the sake of knowledge.

original: tathā sarvakarmasaṃnyāso 'pi jñānārthaḥ śrūyate etam eva pravrājino lokam icchantaḥ pravrajanti /
analyzed: tathā sarva karma saṃnyāsaḥ api jñāna arthaḥ śrūyate etam eva pravrājinaḥ lokam icchantaḥ pravrajanti
translated: Similarly, the renunciation of all actions is also heard to be for the sake of knowledge: Desiring this very world, they go forth.

original: śānto dānta uparatas titikṣuḥ samāhito bhūtvātmany evātmānaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: śāntaḥ dāntaḥ uparataḥ titikṣuḥ samāhitaḥ bhūtvā ātmani eva ātmānam paśyet
translated: Having become tranquil, self-controlled, restrained, patient, and concentrated, one should see the Self in the Self.

original: tyajataiva hi taj jñeyaṃ tyuktuḥ pratyak paraṃ padam /
analyzed: tyajatā eva hi tat jñeyam tyuktuḥ pratyak param padam
translated: For the knower of the Self, the knowable is indeed to be abandoned. For the one who has abandoned, the supreme state is turned away.

original: satyānṛte sukhaduḥkhe
analyzed: satya anṛte sukha duḥkhe
translated: Truth and falsehood, pleasure and pain,

original: vedān imaṃ lokam amuṃ ca parityajyātmānam anvicchet ity ādau /
analyzed: vedān imam lokam amum ca parityajya ātmānam anvicchet iti ādau
translated: having abandoned these Vedas, this world and the other world, one should seek the Self. and so on.

original: tatra karma tattyāgayor ārād upakārakasaṃnipatyopakārakayoḥ prayājāvaghātayor iva na samuccayaḥ sambhavati viruddhatvena yaugapadyābhāvāt
analyzed: tatra karma tad tyāgayoḥ ārāt upakāraka saṃnipatya upakārakayoḥ prayāja avaghātayoḥ iva na samuccayaḥ sambhavati viruddha tvena yaugapadya abhāvāt
translated: There, the combination of action and its renunciation is not possible, like the prayāja and avadāna offerings, which are respectively remote and immediate helpers, because they are contradictory and do not occur simultaneously.

original: nāpi karmatattyāgayor ātmajñānamātraphalatvenaikārthatvād atirātrayoḥ ṣoḍaśigrahaṇāgrahaṇayor iva vikalpaḥ syāt /
analyzed: nā api karma tad tyāgayoḥ ātma jñāna mātra phalatvena ekārtha tvāt atirātrayoḥ ṣoḍaśi grahaṇa agrahaṇayoḥ iva vikalpaḥ syāt
translated: Nor can there be an option between action and its renunciation, like the taking and not taking of the ṣoḍaśi cup in the atirātra sacrifice, because they have the same purpose of being the fruit of the knowledge of the Self alone.

original: dvārabhedenaikārthatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: dvāra bhedena ekārtha tva abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no single purpose through a difference in means.

original: karmaṇo hi pāpakṣayarūpam adṛṣṭam eva dvāraṃ /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ hi pāpa kṣaya rūpam adṛṣṭam eva dvāram
translated: For the unseen, in the form of the destruction of sin, is the only means for action.

original: saṃnyāsasya tu sarvavikṣepābhāvena vicārāvasaradānarūpaṃ dṛṣṭam eva dvāram /
analyzed: saṃnyāsasya tu sarva vikṣepa abhāvena vicāra avasara dāna rūpam dṛṣṭam eva dvāram
translated: But the door of renunciation is seen to be the giving of an opportunity for reflection by the absence of all distractions.

original: niyamāpūrvaṃ tu dṛṣṭasamavāyitvād avaghātādāv iva na prayojakam /
analyzed: niyama apūrvam tu dṛṣṭa samavāyi tvāt avaghāta ādau iva na prayojakam
translated: But the unseen result of the observances, being connected with what is seen, is not a motive, like pounding in the case of the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices.

original: tathā cādṛṣṭārthadṛṣṭārthayor ārād upakārakasaṃnipātyopakārakayor ekapradhānārthatve 'pi vikalpo nāsty eva /
analyzed: tathā ca adṛṣṭa artha dṛṣṭārthayoḥ ārāt upakāraka saṃnipātya upakārakayoḥ eka pradhāna artha tve pi vikalpaḥ na asti eva
translated: And so, even when the unseen result and the seen result, which are remote and proximate auxiliaries respectively, have the same principal purpose, there is no option.

original: prayājāvaghātādīnām api tatprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: prayāja avaghāta ādīnām api tad prasaṅgāt
translated: For then the Prayājas and pounding, etc. would also follow from that.

original: tasmāt krameṇobhayam apy anṣṭheyam /
analyzed: tasmāt krameṇa ubhayam api
translated: Therefore, both should be performed in sequence.

original: tatrāpi saṃnyāsānantaraṃ karmānuṣṭhānaṃ cet tadā
analyzed: tatra api saṃnyāsa anantaram karma anuṣṭhānam ced tadā
translated: Even there, if the performance of action comes after renunciation,

original: parityaktapūrvāśramasvīkāreṇārūḍhapatitatvāt karmānadhikāritvaṃ prāktanasaṃnyāsavaiyarthyaṃ ca tasyādṛṣṭārthatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: parityakta pūrva āśrama svīkāreṇa ārūḍha patita tvāt karma anadhikāri tvam prāktana saṃnyāsa vaiyarthyam ca tasya adṛṣṭārtha tva abhāvāt
translated: then, due to falling from the previously accepted stage of life, there would be no eligibility for action and the previous renunciation would be pointless, because it would not have an unseen result.

original: prathamakṛtasaṃnyāsenaiva jñānādhikāralābhe taduttarakāle karmānuṣṭhānavaiyarthyaṃ ca /
analyzed: prathama kṛta saṃnyāsena eva jñāna adhikāra lābhe tad uttara kāle karma anuṣṭhāna vaiyarthyam ca
translated: If eligibility for knowledge is obtained only by the first renunciation, then the performance of action at a later time would be pointless.

original: tasmād ādau bhagavadarpaṇabuddhyā niṣkāmakarmānuṣṭhānād antaḥkaraṇaśuddhau tīvreṇa
analyzed: tasmāt ādau bhagavat arpaṇa buddhyā niṣkāma karma anuṣṭhānāt antaḥkaraṇa śuddhau tīvreṇa
translated: Therefore, first, by the performance of action without desire, with the thought of the Lord as the reflector, when the purification of the internal organ is intense,

original: vairāgyeṇa vividiṣāyāṃ dṛḍhāyāṃ sarvakarmasaṃnyāsaḥ śravaṇamananādirūpavedāntavākyavicārāya
analyzed: vairāgyeṇa vividiṣāyām dṛḍhāyām sarva karma saṃnyāsaḥ śravaṇa manana ādi rūpa vedānta vākya vicārāya
translated: When there is firm desire to know through detachment, there is renunciation of all actions for the purpose of contemplating the Vedanta statements in the form of listening and reflecting.

original: kartavya iti bhagavato matam /
analyzed: kartavyaḥ iti bhagavataḥ matam
translated: The Lord's opinion is that when there is firm desire to know through detachment, renunciation of all actions should be done for the purpose of investigating the Vedanta statements in the form of listening, reflecting, etc.

original: tathā coktam na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣkarmyaṃ puruṣo 'śnute iti /
analyzed: tathā ca uktam na karmaṇām anārambhāt naiṣkarmyam puruṣaḥ śnute iti
translated: And it is said: By not undertaking actions, a person does not attain freedom from action.

original: vakṣyate ca
analyzed: vakṣyate ca
translated: And it will be said:

original: ārurukṣor muner yogaṃ karma kāraṇam ucyate /
analyzed: ārurukṣoḥ muneḥ yogam karma kāraṇam ucyate
translated: For one who is aspiring to rise to yoga, action is said to be the cause.

original: yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śamaḥ kāraṇam ucyate // Gītā / iti /
analyzed: yoga ārūḍhasya tasya eva śamaḥ kāraṇam ucyate gītāḥ iti
translated: For him who has risen to yoga, tranquility is said to be the cause. (Gita)

original: yogo 'tra tīvravairāgyapūrvikā vividiṣā /
analyzed: yogaḥ tra tīvra vairāgya pūrvikā vividiṣā
translated: Here, yoga is the desire to know preceded by intense detachment.

original: tad uktaṃ vārtikakāraiḥ
analyzed: tat uktam vārtikakāraiḥ
translated: That is said by the authors of the Vartika:

original: pratyag vividiṣāsiddhyai vedānuvacanādayaḥ /
analyzed: pratyak vividiṣā siddhyai veda anuvacana ādayaḥ
translated: For the accomplishment of the desire to know the self, the study of the Vedas etc. are prescribed.

original: brahmāvāptyai tu tattyāga īpsantīti śruter balāt // iti /
analyzed: brahma avāptyai tu tat tyāge īpsanti iti śruteḥ balāt iti
translated: But for the attainment of Brahman, their abandonment is desired by the power of the scriptures.

original: smṛtiś ca 🔽kaṣāyapaṅktiḥ karmāṇi jñānaṃ tu paramā gatiḥ /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ ca  kaṣāya paṅktiḥ karmāṇi jñānam tu paramā gatiḥ
translated: And there is a smrti:🔽The series of astringent [actions] are [performed] by actions, but knowledge is the highest goal.

original: kaṣāye karmabhiḥ pakve tato jñānaṃ pravartate // iti /
analyzed: kaṣāye karmabhiḥ pakve tatas jñānam pravartate iti
translated: When the astringent [actions] are ripened by actions, then knowledge arises.

original: mokṣadharme
analyzed: mokṣadharme
translated: In the Mokshadharma:

original: kaṣāyaṃ pācayitvā ca śreṇīsthāneṣu ca triṣu /
analyzed: kaṣāyam pācayitvā ca śreṇī sthāneṣu ca triṣu
translated: Having ripened the astringent [actions] in the three stages of the series,

original: pravrajec ca paraṃ sthānaṃ pārivrājyam anuttamam //
analyzed: pravrajet ca param sthānam pārivrājyam anuttamam
translated: one should renounce and go to the highest stage, the unsurpassed stage of wandering mendicancy.

original: bhāvinaḥ karaṇaiś cāyaṃ bahusaṃsārayoniṣu /
analyzed: bhāvinaḥ karaṇaiḥ ca ayam bahu saṃsāra yoniṣu
translated: And this one, by means of future instruments, in many births in the cycle of existence,

original: āsādayati śuddhātmā mokṣaṃ vai prathamāśrame //
analyzed: āsādayati śuddha ātmā mokṣam vai prathama āśrame
translated: attains liberation, the pure-souled one, in the first stage of life.

original: tam āsādya tu muktasya dṛṣṭārthasya vipaścitaḥ /
analyzed: tam āsādya tu muktasya dṛṣṭa arthasya vipaścitaḥ
translated: Having attained that, for one who is liberated, whose purpose is seen, who is wise,

original: triṣv āśrameṣu ko nv artho bhavet paramābhīpsitaḥ // iti /
analyzed: triṣu āśrameṣu kaḥ nu arthaḥ bhavet parama abhīpsitaḥ iti
translated: what purpose could there be in the three stages of life, the highest one desired?

original: mokṣaṃ vairāgyam /
analyzed: mokṣam vairāgyam
translated: Liberation means detachment.

original: etena kramākramasaṃnyāso dvāv api darśinau /
analyzed: etena kramākrama saṃnyāsaḥ dvau api darśinau
translated: Thus, both the gradual and immediate renunciation are for the seers.

original: tathā ca śrutiḥ brahmacaryaṃ samāpya gṛhī bhaved gṛhād vanī bhūtvā pravrajed yadi
analyzed: tathā ca śrutiḥ brahmacaryam samāpya gṛhī bhavet gṛhāt vanī bhūtvā pravrajet yadi
translated: And thus the scripture: Having completed celibacy, one should become a householder. From the householder's stage, one should become a forest hermit, and then a wandering ascetic, if

original: vetarathā brahmacaryād eva pravrajed gṛhād vā vanād vā yad ahar eva virajet tad ahar eva pravrajet iti /
analyzed: vā itarathā brahmacaryāt eva pravrajet gṛhāt vā vanāt vā yat ahar eva virajet tat ahar eva pravrajet iti
translated: otherwise, one should become a wandering ascetic directly from celibacy, or from the householder's stage, or from the forest hermit's stage. On the very day one becomes detached, on that very day one should become a wandering ascetic.

original: tasmād ajñasyāviraktatādaśāyāṃ karmānuṣṭhānam eva /
analyzed: tasmāt ajñasya avirakta tā daśāyām karma anuṣṭhānam eva
translated: Therefore, for one who is ignorant and in a state of non-detachment, only the performance of duties is prescribed.

original: tasyaiva viraktatādaśāyāṃ saṃnyāsaḥ śravaṇādyavasaradānena jñānārthaṃ iti daśābhedenājñam adhikṛtyaiva karmatattyāgau vyākhyātuṃ pañcamaṣaṣṭhāv
analyzed: tasya eva virakta tā daśāyām saṃnyāsaḥ śravaṇa ādi avasara dānena jñāna artham iti daśā bhedena ajñam adhikṛtya eva karma tad tyāgau vyākhyātum pañcama ṣaṣṭhau
translated: For him alone, in a state of detachment, renunciation is for the sake of knowledge by giving an opportunity for listening etc. Thus, in order to explain the duties and renunciation only for one who is ignorant and in different states, the fifth and sixth chapters

original: adhyāyāv ārabhyete /
analyzed: adhyāyau ārabhyete
translated: are begun.

original: vidvatsaṃnyāsas tu jñānabalād arthasiddha eveti sandehābhāvān na vicāryate /
analyzed: vidvas saṃnyāsaḥ tu jñāna balāt artha siddhaḥ evā iti sandeha abhāvāt na vicāryate
translated: But the renunciation of the knower is accomplished by the power of knowledge itself, so it is not discussed here because there is no doubt.

original: tatraikam eva jijñāsum ajñaṃ prati jñānārthatvena karmatattyāgayor vigdhānāt tayoś
analyzed: tatra ekam eva jijñāsum ajñam prati jñāna artha tvena karma tad tyāgayoḥ tayoḥ
translated: There, for the sake of knowledge, the renunciation and performance of duties are enjoined for a single seeker of knowledge who is ignorant.

original: ca viruddhayor yugapad anuṣṭhānāsambhavān mayā jijñāsunā kim idānīm anuṣṭheyam iti
analyzed: ca viruddhayoḥ yugapad anuṣṭhāna asambhavāt mayā jijñāsunā kim idānīm anuṣṭheyam iti
translated: And because those two are contradictory and cannot be performed simultaneously, I, the seeker, now wonder, What should I do?

original: sandihāno 'rjuna uvāca saṃnyāsam iti /
analyzed: sandihānaḥ rjunaḥ uvāca saṃnyāsam iti
translated: Thinking thus, Arjuna said, Renunciation.

original: he kṛṣṇa / sadānandarūpa bhaktaduḥkhakarṣaṇeti vā /🔽karmaṇāṃ yāvajjīvādiśrutivihitānāṃ nityānāṃ naimittikānāṃ ca saṃnyāsaṃ tyāgaṃ
analyzed: he kṛṣṇa sadānanda rūpa bhakta duḥkha karṣaṇa iti vā  karmaṇām yāvajjīva ādi śruti vihitānām nityānām naimittikānām ca saṃnyāsam tyāgam
translated: O Krishna, who is always blissful, or who removes the suffering of devotees.🔽You speak of the renunciation, the giving up, of duties that are enjoined by the scriptures like as long as one lives and so on, for the sake of a seeker of knowledge who is ignorant.

original: jijñāsum ajñaṃ prati kathayasi vedamukhena punas tadviruddhaṃ yogaṃ ca karmānuṣṭhānarūpaṃ śaṃsasi /
analyzed: jijñāsum ajñam prati kathayasi veda mukhena punar tad viruddham yogam ca karma anuṣṭhāna rūpam śaṃsasi
translated: And again, through the mouth of the Vedas, you praise yoga, which is the performance of duties, and which is contradictory to that.

original: etam eva pravrājino lokam icchantaḥ pravrajanti /
analyzed: etam eva pravrājinaḥ lokam icchantaḥ pravrajanti
translated: Desiring this very world, the renunciates go forth.

original: tam etaṃ vedānuvacanena brāhmaṇā vividiṣanti yajñena ity ādivākyadvayena
analyzed: tam etam veda anuvacanena brāhmaṇāḥ vividiṣanti yajñena iti ādi vākya dvayena
translated: By the two statements beginning with The Brahmins seek to know him through the recitation of the Vedas, through sacrifice, and so on,

original: nirāśīr yatacittātmā tyaktasarvaparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: nirāśīḥ yata citta ātmā tyakta sarva parigrahaḥ
translated: He who is without desire, whose mind and self are controlled, who has given up all possessions,

original: śārīraṃ kevalaṃ karma kurvann āpnoti kilbiṣam // Gītā /
analyzed: śārīram kevalam karma kurvan āpnoti kilbiṣam gītā
translated: By performing only the bodily actions, one incurs sin.

original: chittvainaṃ saṃśayaṃ yogam ātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata iti gītāvākyadvayena vā /
analyzed: chittvā enam saṃśayam yogam ātiṣṭha uttiṣṭha bhārata iti gītā vākya dvayena vā
translated: Or by the two statements of the Gita, Having cut off this doubt, take up yoga, arise, O descendant of Bharata.

original: tatraikam ajñaṃ prati karmatattyāgayor vidhānād yugapad ubhayānuṣṭhānasambhavād
analyzed: tatra ekam ajñam prati karma tad tyāgayoḥ vidhānāt yugapad ubhaya anuṣṭhāna sambhavāt
translated: There, to one who is ignorant, because of the injunction of the renunciation of action, it is possible to perform both simultaneously.

original: etayoḥ karmatattyāgayor madhye yad ekaṃ śreyaḥ praśasyataraṃ manyase karma vā tattyāgaṃ
analyzed: etayoḥ karma tad tyāgayoḥ madhye yat ekam śreyaḥ praśasyataram manyase karma vā tad tyāgam
translated: Between these two, the renunciation of action, which one considers to be better, more praiseworthy, whether it be action or its renunciation,

original: vā tan me brūhi suniścitaṃ tava matam anuṣṭhānāya // //
analyzed: vā tat me brūhi su niścitam tava matam anuṣṭhānāya
translated: tell me that, your well-ascertained opinion, for the purpose of practice.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: proktaṃ jñānād api śreṣṭhaṃ karma taddāṛḍhyasiddhaye /
analyzed: proktam jñānāt api śreṣṭham karma tad dāṛḍhya siddhaye
translated: Action, which is said to be superior even to knowledge, for the sake of strengthening it,

original: tatpadārthasya ca jñānaṃ sāmyād yā api pañcame //
analyzed: tad padārthasya ca jñānam sāmyāt yāḥ api pañcame
translated: And the knowledge of that object, which is also in the fifth chapter, due to equality.

original: pūrvādhyāyānte śrutena vākyadvāreṇa virodham āśaṅkamānaḥ pṛcchati sannyāsam iti /
analyzed: pūrva adhyāya ante śrutena vākya dvāreṇa virodham āśaṅkamānaḥ pṛcchati sannyāsam iti
translated: Suspecting contradiction by the two statements heard at the end of the previous chapter, he asks about renunciation, etc.

original: yogasaṃnyastakarmāṇaṃ jñānasaṃchinnasaṃśayam /
analyzed: yoga saṃnyasta karmāṇam jñāna saṃchinna saṃśayam
translated: For one who has renounced actions by yoga, whose doubts have been cut off by knowledge,

original: ātmavantaṃ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanaṃjaya // Gītā /
analyzed: ātmavantam na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanaṃjaya gītā
translated: O Dhananjaya, actions do not bind one who is self-possessed. Gita.

original: iti vākyena tvaṃ karmayogenotpannajñānasya karmasaṃnyāsaṃ brūṣe /
analyzed: iti vākyena tvam karma yogena utpanna jñānasya karma saṃnyāsam brūṣe
translated: Thus, by this statement, you speak of the renunciation of action for one who has attained knowledge through the yoga of action.

original: tasmād ajñānasaṃbhūtaṃ hṛtsthaṃ jñānāsinātmanaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt ajñāna saṃbhūtam hṛd stham jñāna asinā ātmanaḥ
translated: Therefore, That which has arisen from ignorance, residing in the heart, cut it off with the sword of knowledge, O self.

original: chittvainaṃ saṃśayaṃ yogam ātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata // Gītā /
analyzed: chittvā enam saṃśayam yogam ātiṣṭha uttiṣṭha bhārata gītā
translated: Having cut this doubt, resort to yoga, arise, O descendant of Bharata. (Bhagavad Gita) ,

original: ity anena punas tasyaiva karmayogaṃ ca brūṣe /
analyzed: iti anena punar tasya eva karma yogam ca brūṣe
translated: By this, you again speak of the yoga of action for the same person.

original: na ca karmasaṃnyāsaḥ karmayogaś ca ekasyaiva ekadaiva sambhavataḥ /
analyzed: na ca karma saṃnyāsaḥ karma yogaḥ ca ekasya eva ekadā eva sambhavataḥ
translated: And renunciation of action and the yoga of action cannot exist for the same person at the same time.

original: sthitigativat viruddhasvarūpatvāt /
analyzed: sthiti gati vat viruddha svarūpa tvāt
translated: Because they have contradictory natures, like staying and going.

original: tasmāj jñānī karmasaṃnyāsaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tasmāt jñānī karma saṃnyāsam kuryāt
translated: Therefore, the knower of the Self should either renounce action

original: karmayogaṃ vā kuryād iti tvadabhiprāyam anavagato /
analyzed: karma yogam vā kuryāt iti tvad abhiprāyam an avagataḥ
translated: or perform the yoga of action. This is your intention, which I have not understood.

original: haṃ pṛcchāmi etayor madhye yad ekaṃ śreyas tvayā suniścitam tan me brūhi ////
analyzed: ham pṛcchāmi etayoḥ madhye yat ekam śreyaḥ tvayā su niścitam tat me brūhi
translated: I ask you, tell me which one of these two is best, as determined by you.

original: baladevaḥ /
analyzed: baladevaḥ
translated: Balarama.

original: jñānataḥ karmaṇaḥ śraiṣṭhyaṃ sukaratvādinā hariḥ /
analyzed: jñānataḥ karmaṇaḥ śraiṣṭhyam sukara tva ādinā hariḥ
translated: Hari (Krishna) has said in the fifth chapter that knowledge is superior to action because it is easier and so on,

original: śuddhasya tadakartṛtvaṃ tvety ādi prāha pañcame //
analyzed: śuddhasya tad akartṛ tvam tvā iti ādi prāha pañcame
translated: and that one who is pure is not its agent, etc.

original: dvitīye mumukṣuṃ praty ātmavijñānaṃ mocakam abhidhāya tadupāyayā niṣkāmaṃ karma kartavyam abhyadhāt /
analyzed: dvitīye mumukṣum prati ātma vijñānam mocakam abhidhāya tad upāyayā niṣkāmam karma kartavyam abhyadhāt
translated: In the second chapter, having stated that the knowledge of the Self is liberating for one who desires liberation, He said that action without desire should be performed as a means to that knowledge.

original: labdhavijñānasya na kiṃcit karmāstīti yas tv ātmaratir eva syāt iti tṛtīye /
analyzed: labdha vijñānasya na kiṃcid karma asti iti yaḥ tu ātma ratiḥ eva syāt iti tṛtīye
translated: But in the third chapter, For one who has attained knowledge, there is no action at all, and One should be engaged in one's own duty, he said.

original: sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ pārtha iti caturthe cāvādīt /
analyzed: sarvam karma akhilam pārtha iti caturthe ca avādīt
translated: And in the fourth chapter, All action, O son of Prtha, he said.

original: ante tu tasmād ajñānasaṃbhūtaṃ Gītā / ity ādinā tasyaiva punaḥ karmayogaṃ prāvocat /
analyzed: ante tu tasmāt ajñāna saṃbhūtam gītāḥ iti ādinā tasya eva punar karma yogam prāvocat
translated: But in the end, beginning with the verse, Therefore, the renunciation of action that arises from ignorance, etc., he again taught the yoga of action to him.

original: tatrārjunaḥ pṛcchati saṃnyāsam iti /
analyzed: tatra arjunaḥ pṛcchati saṃnyāsam iti
translated: There, Arjuna asks about renunciation in the verse beginning with Renunciation, O Keshava.

original: he kṛṣṇa /
analyzed: he kṛṣṇa
translated: O Krishna.

original: karmaṇāṃ sannyāsaṃ sarvendriyavyāpāraviratirūpaṃ jñānayogam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: karmaṇām sannyāsam sarva indriya vyāpāra virati rūpam jñāna yogam iti arthaḥ
translated: The renunciation of actions means the cessation of all bodily and mental activities, which is the meaning of the yoga of knowledge.

original: punar yogaṃ karmānuṣṭhānaṃ ca sarvendriyavyāpārarūpaṃ śaṃsasi /
analyzed: punar yogam karma anuṣṭhānam ca sarva indriya vyāpāra rūpam śaṃsasi
translated: Again, you praise the yoga of action, which is the performance of actions and the engagement of all bodily and mental faculties.

original: na caikasya yugapat tau sambhavetāṃ /
analyzed: na ca ekasya yugapad tau sambhavetām
translated: And those two cannot exist simultaneously for one person.

original: sthitigativat tamastejovac ca viruddhasvarūpatvāt /
analyzed: sthiti gati vat tamaḥ tejaḥ vat ca viruddha svarūpa tvāt
translated: Because they are contradictory in nature, like rest and motion, or darkness and light.

original: tasmāl labdhajñānaḥ karma sannyased anutiṣṭhed veti bhavadabhimataṃ vettum aśakto 'haṃ pṛcchāmi /
analyzed: tasmāt labdha jñānaḥ karma san nyaset anutiṣṭhet vā iti bhavat abhimatam vettum aśaktaḥ ham pṛcchāmi
translated: Therefore, not being able to understand what you intend, namely, whether one who has attained knowledge should renounce action or perform it, I ask.

original: etayoḥ karmasannyāsakarmānuṣṭhānayor yad ekaṃ śreyas
analyzed: etayoḥ karma sannyāsa karma anuṣṭhānayoḥ yat ekam śreyaḥ
translated: Which one of these two, the renunciation of action or the performance of action,

original: tvayā suniścitaṃ tattvaṃ me brūhīti ////🔽BhG /🔽śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: tvayā su niścitam tattvam me brūhi iti 🔽bhg 🔽śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: is better for me? Tell me that truth which you have ascertained well.

original: saṃnyāsaḥ karmayogaś ca niḥśreyasakarāv ubhau /
analyzed: saṃnyāsaḥ karma yogaḥ ca niḥśreyasa karau ubhau
translated: Renunciation and Karma-yoga both lead to the highest good.

original: tayos tu karmasaṃnyāsāt karmayogo viśiṣyate ////
analyzed: tayoḥ tu karma saṃnyāsāt karma yogaḥ viśiṣyate
translated: But of the two, Karma-yoga is superior to renunciation of action.

original: śrīdharaḥ / atrottaraṃ śrībhagavān uvāca saṃnyāsa iti /
analyzed: uvāca   iti
translated: Here, in reply, the Lord says: Renunciation, etc.

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ na hi vedāntavedyātmatattvajñaṃ prati karmayogam ahaṃ bravīmi /
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ na hi vedānta vedya ātma tattva jñam prati karmayogam aham bravīmi
translated: The idea is this: I do not speak of Karma-yoga to one who knows the truth of the Self, which is to be known through the Vedanta.

original: yataḥ pūrvoktena saṃnyāsena virodhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yatas pūrva uktena saṃnyāsena virodhaḥ syāt
translated: Because there would be a contradiction with the previously mentioned renunciation.

original: api tu dehātmābhimāninaṃ tvāṃ bandhuvadhādinimittaśokamohādikṛtam enaṃ saṃśayaṃ dehātmavivekajñānāsinā chittvā paramātmajñānopāyabhūtaṃ
analyzed: api tu deha ātma abhimāninam tvām bandhu vadha ādi nimitta śoka moha ādi kṛtam enam saṃśayam deha ātma viveka jñāna asinā chittvā paramātma jñāna upāya bhūtam
translated: But I tell you, who are under the impression of the identity of the body and the Self, that having cut off this doubt, which is caused by grief, delusion, etc. due to the killing of relatives, etc., with the sword of the knowledge of the distinction between the body and the Self,

original: karmayogam ātiṣṭheti bravīmi /
analyzed: karma yogam ātiṣṭha iti bravīmi
translated: you should take up Karma-yoga, which is the means to the knowledge of the Supreme Self.

original: karmayogena śuddhacittasyātmatattvajñāne jāte sati tatparipākārthaṃ jñānaniṣṭhāṅgatvena saṃnyāsaḥ pūrvam uktaḥ /
analyzed: karma yogena śuddha cittasya ātma tattva jñāne jāte sati tad paripāka artham jñāna niṣṭhā aṅga tvena saṃnyāsaḥ pūrvam uktaḥ
translated: When, due to Karma-yoga, the knowledge of the truth of the Self arises in the purified mind, then renunciation, which is a limb of the stage of knowledge, is mentioned first for the purpose of its development.

original: evaṃ saty aṅgapradhānayor vikalpayogāt saṃnyāsaḥ karmayogaś cety etāv ubhāv api bhūmikābhedena samuccitāv eva niḥśreyasaṃ sādhayataḥ /
analyzed: evam sati aṅga pradhānayoḥ vikalpa yogāt saṃnyāsaḥ karma yogaḥ ca iti etau ubhau api bhūmikā bhedena samuccitau eva niḥśreyasam sādhayataḥ
translated: Thus, since there is an option between the limb and the principal, both renunciation and Karma-yoga, being combined as different stages, alone accomplish the highest good.

original: tathāpi tu tayor madhye tu karmasaṃnyāsāt sakāśāt karmayogo viśiṣṭo bhavatīti ////
analyzed: tathā api tu tayoḥ madhye tu karma saṃnyāsāt sakāśāt karma yogaḥ viśiṣṭaḥ bhavati iti
translated: Still, between the two, Karma-yoga is superior to renunciation of action.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: evam arjunasya praśne taduttaram śrībhagavān uvāca saṃnyāsa iti /
analyzed: evam arjunasya praśne tad uttaram śrī bhagavān uvāca saṃnyāsaḥ iti
translated: Thus, when Arjuna asked this, the Lord replied, Renunciation, etc.

original: niḥśreyasakarau jñānotpattihetutvena mokṣopayoginau /
analyzed: niḥśreyasa karau jñāna utpatti hetu tvena mokṣa upayoginau
translated: They are the causes of the origin of knowledge and are useful for liberation.

original: tayos tu karmasaṃnyāsād anadhikārikṛtāt karmayogo viśiṣyate śreyān adhikārasampādakatvena ////
analyzed: tayoḥ tu karma saṃnyāsāt anadhikāri kṛtāt karmayogaḥ viśiṣyate śreyān adhikāra sampādaka tvena
translated: But Karma-yoga is superior to the renunciation of action by one who is not qualified.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: karmayogo viśiṣyata iti jñāninaḥ karmakaraṇe na ko 'pi doṣaḥ /
analyzed: karma yogaḥ viśiṣyate iti jñāninaḥ karma karaṇe na kaḥ pi doṣaḥ
translated: Karma-yoga is superior. There is no fault in a knower of the Self performing actions.

original: pratyuta niṣkāmakarmaṇā cittaśuddhidārḍhyāj jñānadārḍhyam eva syāt /
analyzed: pratyuta niṣkāma karmaṇā citta śuddhi dārḍhyāt jñāna dārḍhyam eva syāt
translated: Rather, by the firmness of purification of the mind through selfless action, the knowledge itself would become firm.

original: saṃnyāsinas tu kadācit cittavaiguṇye sati tadupaśamanārthaṃ kiṃ karma niṣiddham /
analyzed: saṃnyāsinaḥ tu kadācid citta vaiguṇye sati tad upaśamana artham kim karma niṣiddham
translated: But for a renunciant, if there is sometimes a defect in the mind, then what action is prohibited for the purpose of alleviating that?

original: jñānābhyāsapratibandhakaṃ tu cittavaiguṇyam eva /
translated: But the defect in the mind is only an impediment to the practice of knowledge.

original: viṣayagrahaṇe tu vāntāśitvam eva syād iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: viṣaya grahaṇe tu vānta āśi tvam eva syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But in the case of grasping objects, there would be only the state of one who has vomited and eaten again. This is the idea.

original: baladevaḥ / evaṃ pṛṣṭo śrībhagavān uvāca saṃnyāsa iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam pṛṣṭaḥ śrī bhagavān uvāca saṃnyāsaḥ iti
translated: Balarama: Thus asked, the Lord said, Renunciation, etc.

original: niḥśreyasakarau muktihetū /🔽karmasaṃnyāsāj jñānayogād viśiṣyate śreṣṭho bhavati /
analyzed: niḥśreyasa karau mukti hetū  karma saṃnyāsāt jñāna yogāt viśiṣyate śreṣṭhaḥ bhavati
translated: The two are the causes of liberation, which is the highest good.🔽The Karma-yoga is superior, is the best, to the renunciation of action.

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ na khalu labdhajñānasyāpi karmayogo doṣāvahaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ na khalu labdha jñānasya api karma yogaḥ doṣa āvahaḥ
translated: The idea is this: For one who has attained knowledge, Karma-yoga is not a cause of defect.

original: kintu jñānagarbhatvāj jñānadārḍhyakṛd eva /
analyzed: kintu jñāna garbha tvāt jñāna dārḍhya kṛt eva
translated: But because it is full of knowledge, it is only a means of strengthening knowledge.

original: jñānaniṣṭhatayā karmasannyāsinas tu cittadoṣe sati taddoṣavināśāya karmānuṣṭheyaṃ pratiṣedhakaśāstrāt /
analyzed: jñāna niṣṭha tayā karma sannyāsinaḥ tu citta doṣe sati tad doṣa vināśāya karma anuṣṭheyam pratiṣedhaka śāstrāt
translated: But for one who has renounced action due to being devoted to knowledge, if there is a defect in the mind, one should perform action for the destruction of that defect, as per the prohibitive scriptures.

original: karmatyāgavākyāni tv ātmani ratau satyāṃ karmāṇi taṃ svayaṃ tjayantīty āhuḥ /
analyzed: karma tyāga vākyāni tu ātmani ratau satyām karmāṇi tam svayam tjayanti iti āhuḥ
translated: The statements about renouncing action say that when one is devoted to the Self, actions themselves liberate him.

original: tasmāt sukaratvād apramādatvāj jñānagarbhatvāc ca karmayogaḥ śreyān iti ////
analyzed: tasmāt sukara tvāt apramāda tvāt jñāna garbha tvāt ca karmayogaḥ śreyān iti
translated: Therefore, Karma-yoga is better because it is easy, because it is not careless, and because it is full of knowledge.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad-gita 5.13)

original: jñeyaḥ sa nityasaṃnyāsī yo na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati /
analyzed: jñeyaḥ sa nitya saṃnyāsī yaḥ na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati
translated: He who neither hates nor desires should be known as a constant renunciator.

original: nirdvandvo hi mahābāho sukhaṃ bandhāt pramucyate ////
analyzed: nirdvandvaḥ hi mahā bāho sukham bandhāt pramucyate
translated: For one who is free from the pairs of opposites, O mighty-armed one, is happy and is liberated from bondage.🔽(Bhagavad-gita 5.14)

original: śrīdharaḥ / kuta ity apekṣāyāṃ saṃnyāsitvena karmayoginaṃ stuvaṃs tasya śreṣṭhatvaṃ darśayati jñeya iti /
translated: Sri Sridhara. When there is expectation of why?, praising the Karma-yogin as a renunciator, he shows the superiority of that [Karma-yoga] by saying should be known.

original: rāgadveṣādirāhityena parameśvarārthaṃ karmāṇi yo 'nutiṣṭhati sa nityaṃ karmānuṣṭhānakāle 'pi saṃnyāsīty evaṃ jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: rāga dveṣa ādi rāhityena parameśvara artham karmāṇi yaḥ nutiṣṭhati sa nityam karma anuṣṭhāna kāle saṃnyāsī iti evam jñeyaḥ
translated: He who performs actions for the Supreme Lord without attachment to love and hate, he should be known as a renunciant even while constantly engaged in performing actions.

original: tatra hetuḥ nirdvandvo rāgadveṣādidvandvaśūnyo hi śuddhacitto jñānadvārā sukham anāyāsenaiva bandhāt saṃsārāt pramucyate ////
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ nirdvandvaḥ rāga dveṣa ādi dvandva śūnyaḥ hi śuddha cittaḥ jñāna dvārā sukham anāyāsena eva bandhāt saṃsārāt pramucyate
translated: The reason for that is: for one who is free from the pairs of opposites such as love and hate, who has a pure mind, is liberated from bondage, from worldly existence, through knowledge, without any effort.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: tam eva karmayogaṃ stauti jñeya iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: tam eva karma yogam stauti jñeyaḥ iti tribhiḥ
translated: He praises that very Karma-yoga with three verses beginning with jneyah.

original: sa karmaṇi pravṛtto 'pi nityaṃ saṃnyāsīti jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: sa karmaṇi pravṛttaḥ u pi nityam saṃnyāsī iti jñeyaḥ
translated: He who is engaged in action should be known as a renunciant always.

original: ko 'sau / yo na dveṣṭi bhagavadarpaṇabuddhyā kriyamāṇaṃ karma niṣphalatvaśaṅkayā /
analyzed: kaḥ sau yaḥ na dveṣṭi bhagavat arpaṇa buddhyā kriyamāṇam karma niṣphala tva śaṅkayā
translated: Who is he? He who does not hate action done with the thought of it being an offering to the Lord, out of doubt about its being fruitless.

original: na kāṅkṣati svargādikam /
analyzed: na kāṅkṣati svarga ādikam
translated: Nor does he desire heaven etc.

original: nirdvandvo rāgadveṣarahito hi yasmāt sukham anāyāsena he mahābāho bandhād antaḥkaraṇāśuddhirūpāj
analyzed: nirdvandvaḥ rāga dveṣa rahitaḥ hi yasmāt sukham anāyāsena he mahā bāho bandhāt antaḥkaraṇa aśuddhi rūpāt
translated: For one who is free from the pairs of opposites such as love and hate, O mighty-armed one, is liberated from bondage, from the obstruction to knowledge in the form of impurity of the internal organ, through happiness without effort.

original: jñānapratibandhāt pramucyate nityānityavastuvivekādiprakarṣeṇa mukto bhavati // //
analyzed: jñāna pratibandhāt pramucyate nitya anitya vastu viveka ādi prakarṣeṇa muktaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes liberated through the excellence of discrimination between the eternal and non-eternal things etc.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: na ca sannyāsaprāpyo mokṣo 'kṛtasaṃnyāsenaiva tena na prāpya iti vācyam ity āha jñeya iti /
analyzed: na ca sannyāsa prāpyaḥ mokṣaḥ kṛta saṃnyāsena eva tena na prāpyaḥ iti vācyam iti āha jñeyaḥ iti
translated: And it should not be said that liberation, which is to be attained by renunciation, is not to be attained by him who has not performed renunciation. Thus he says: To be known.

original: sa tu śuddhacittaḥ karmī nityasaṃnyāsī eva jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: sa tu śuddha cittaḥ karmī nitya saṃnyāsī eva jñeyaḥ
translated: But he, with a pure mind, the man of action, is always a renunciator.

original: he mahābāho iti muktinagarīṃ jetuṃ sa eva mahāvīra iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: he mahābāho iti muktinagarīm jetum saḥ eva mahāvīraḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: O mighty-armed one, he alone is the great hero to conquer the city of liberation, is the meaning.

original: baladevaḥ / kuto viśiṣyate tatrāha jñeya iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ kutas viśiṣyate tatra āha jñeyaḥ iti
translated: Balarama. From where does he differ? There he says: To be known.

original: sa viśuddhacittaḥ karmayogī nityasaṃnyāsī /
analyzed: sa viśuddha cittaḥ karma yogī nitya saṃnyāsī
translated: He, with a pure mind, the man of action, is always a renunciator.

original: sa sarvadā jñānayoganiṣṭho jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: sa sarvadā jñāna yoga niṣṭhaḥ jñeyaḥ
translated: He, always devoted to the yoga of knowledge, is to be known.

original: yaḥ karmāntargatātmānubhavānandaparitṛptas tato 'nyat kiṃcit na kāṅkṣati na ca dveṣṭi /
analyzed: yaḥ karma antargata ātma anubhava ānanda paritṛptaḥ tatas kiṃcid na kāṅkṣati na ca dveṣṭi
translated: He who is satisfied with the bliss of experiencing the Self within action, does not desire anything else, nor does he hate anything.

original: nirdvandvo dvandvasahiṣṇuḥ sukham anāyāsena sukarakarmaniṣṭhayety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: nirdvandvaḥ dvandva sahiṣṇuḥ sukham anāyāsena sukara karma niṣṭhayā iti arthaḥ
translated: Free from duality, tolerant of opposites, he is devoted to easy action without difficulty, is the meaning.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: sāṃkhyayogau pṛthag bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: sāṃkhya yogau pṛthak bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ
translated: Fools, not the wise, speak of Sāṃkhya and Yoga as separate.

original: ekam apy āsthitaḥ samyag ubhayor vindate phalam ////
analyzed: ekam api āsthitaḥ samyak ubhayoḥ vindate phalam
translated: One who is firmly established in either attains the fruit of both.

original: śrīdharaḥ / yasmād evam aṅgapradhānatvenobhayor avasthābhedena kramasamuccayaḥ /
translated: Śrīdhara. Since it is so, the two are in a state of subordination and primacy, with a sequence and combination of states.

original: ato vikalpam aṅgīkṛtyobhayoḥ kaḥ śreṣṭha iti praśno 'jñāninām evocitaḥ /
analyzed: atas vikalpam aṅgīkṛtya ubhayoḥ kaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ iti praśnaḥ jñāninām eva ucitaḥ
translated: Therefore, accepting the option, the question of which of the two is superior is proper only for the ignorant,

original: na vivekinām ity āha sāṅkhyayogāv iti /
analyzed: na vivekinām iti āha sāṅkhya yogau iti
translated: not for the discerning. Thus he says, 'The Sankhya and the Yoga...'

original: sāṅkhyaśabdena jñānaniṣṭhāvācinā tadaṅgaṃ saṃnyāsaṃ lakṣayati /
analyzed: sāṅkhya śabdena jñāna niṣṭhā vācinā tad aṅgam saṃnyāsam lakṣayati
translated: By the word 'Sankhya', which denotes the state of knowledge, he indicates renunciation, which is a part of it.

original: saṃnyāsakarmayogau ekaphalau santau pṛthak svatantrāv iti bālā ajñā eva pravadanti na tu paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: saṃnyāsa karma yogau eka phalau santau pṛthak svatantrau iti bālāḥ ajñāḥ eva pravadanti na tu paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The ignorant alone, not the wise, say that renunciation and Karma-yoga, though having the same result, are separate and independent.

original: tatra hetuḥ anayor ekam apy samyag āsthita āśritavān ubhayor api phalam āpnoti /
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ anayoḥ ekam api samyak āsthitaḥ āśritavān ubhayoḥ api phalam āpnoti
translated: The reason for that is: one who properly resorts to either of these two obtains the fruit of both.

original: tathā hi karmayogaṃ samyag anutiṣṭhan śuddhacittaḥ san jñānadvārā yad ubhayoḥ phalaṃ kaivalyaṃ tad vindati /
analyzed: tathā hi karmayogam samyak anutiṣṭhan śuddha cittaḥ san jñāna dvārā yat ubhayoḥ phalam kaivalyam tat vindati
translated: For thus, one who properly practices Karma-yoga, with a pure mind, attains through knowledge that which is the fruit of both, namely, liberation.

original: saṃnyāsaṃ samyag āsthito 'pi pūrvam anuṣṭhitasya karmayogasyāpi paramparayā jñānadvārā yad ubhayoḥ phalaṃ kaivalyaṃ tad vindatīti na pṛthak
analyzed: saṃnyāsam samyak pūrvam anuṣṭhitasya karmayogasya api paramparayā jñāna dvārā yat ubhayoḥ phalam kaivalyam tat vindati iti na pṛthak
translated: One who properly resorts to renunciation also attains through knowledge, indirectly, that which is the fruit of both, namely, liberation, even of Karma-yoga previously performed. Thus they do not have separate

original: phalatvam anayor ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: phala tvam anayoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: fruits. This is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: nanu yaḥ karmaṇi pravṛttaḥ sa kathaṃ saṃnyāsīti jñātavyaḥ karmatattyāgayoḥ svarūpavirodhāt phalaikyāt tatheti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu yaḥ karmaṇi pravṛttaḥ sa katham saṃnyāsī iti jñātavyaḥ karma tad tyāgayoḥ svarūpa virodhāt phala aikyāt tathā iti ced na
translated: Objection: But how can one who is engaged in action be known as a renunciate, since action and renunciation are mutually contradictory in their very nature? If it be said that this is so because their fruits are the same, we reply: No.

original: svarūpato viruddhayoḥ phale 'pi virodhasyaucityāt /
analyzed: svarūpataḥ viruddhayoḥ phale virodhasya aucityāt
translated: For when two things are contradictory in their very nature, it is only proper that their fruits also should be contradictory.

original: tathā ca niḥśreyasakarāv ubhāv ity anupapannam ity āśaṅkyāha sāṃkhyayogāv iti /
analyzed: tathā ca niḥśreyasa karau ubhau iti anupapannam iti āśaṅkya āha sāṃkhya yogau iti
translated: And in that case, it is improper to say that both lead to the highest good. Anticipating this doubt, the Lord says, 'The Sankhya and the Yoga' (are the same).

original: saṃkhyā samyag ātmabuddhis tāṃ vahatīti jñānāntaraṅgasādhanatayā sāṅkhyaḥ saṃnyāsaḥ /
analyzed: saṃkhyā samyak ātma buddhiḥ tām vahati iti jñāna antaraṅga sādhanatayā sāṅkhyaḥ saṃnyāsaḥ
translated: Sankhya is renunciation, which carries (vahati) right knowledge of the Self (samyak atma-buddhi). It is called Sankhya because it is the inner means of knowledge.

original: yogaḥ pūrvoktakarmayogaḥ /
translated: Yoga is the aforementioned Karma-yoga.

original: tau pṛthag viruddhaphalau bālāḥ śāstrārthavivekajñānaśūnyāḥ pravadanti /
analyzed: tau pṛthak viruddha phalau bālāḥ śāstra artha viveka jñāna śūnyāḥ pravadanti
translated: Fools, who are devoid of the knowledge of discriminating the meaning of the scriptures, say that these two have separate and contradictory fruits.

original: na paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: na paṇḍitāḥ
translated: But not the wise.

original: kiṃ tarhi paṇḍitānāṃ matam /🔽ucyate ekam apy saṃnyāsakarmaṇor madhye samyag āsthitaḥ svādhikārānurūpeṇa samyag
analyzed: kim tarhi paṇḍitānām matam  ucyate ekam api saṃnyāsa karmaṇoḥ madhye samyak āsthitaḥ sva adhikāra anurūpeṇa samyak
translated: What then is the opinion of the wise?🔽It is said: One who is properly engaged in either one of the two, renunciation or action, and has properly performed (his duty) according to his own right,

original: yathāśāstraṃ kṛtavān sann ubhayor vindate phalam jñānotpattidvāreṇa niḥśreyasam ekam eva // //
analyzed: yathāśāstram kṛtavān san ubhayoḥ vindate phalam jñāna utpatti dvāreṇa niḥśreyasam ekam eva
translated: by attaining to Knowledge, attains the one highest good, through the means of the arising of Knowledge.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: tasmād yac chreya evaitayor iti tvaduktam api vastuto na ghaṭate /
analyzed: tasmāt yat śreyaḥ eva etayoḥ iti tvad uktam api vastutas na ghaṭate
translated: Therefore, what you said that one of these two is better, that also does not hold in fact.

original: vivekibhir ubhayoḥ pārthakyābhāvasya dṛṣṭatvād ity āha sāṃkhyayogāv iti /
analyzed: vivekibhiḥ ubhayoḥ pārthakya abhāvasya dṛṣṭa tvāt iti āha sāṃkhya yogau iti
translated: Because the absence of the independence of both has been seen by the wise. Thus he says: 'Sāṃkhya and Yoga' etc.

original: sāṃkhyaśabdena jñānaniṣṭhāvācinā tadaṅgaḥ saṃnyāso lakṣyate /
analyzed: sāṃkhya śabdena jñāna niṣṭhā vācinā tad aṅgaḥ saṃnyāsaḥ lakṣyate
translated: By the word 'Sāṃkhya', which denotes the stage of knowledge, renunciation which is its limb is indicated.

original: saṃnyāsakarmayogau pṛthak svatantrāv iti bālāḥ vadanti /
analyzed: saṃnyāsa karma yogau pṛthak svatantrau iti bālāḥ vadanti
translated: Fools say that renunciation and Karma-yoga are separate and independent.

original: na tu vijñāḥ jñeyaḥ sa nityasaṃnyāsī iti pūrvokteḥ /
analyzed: na tu vijñāḥ jñeyaḥ sa nitya saṃnyāsī iti pūrvokteḥ
translated: But not the wise, because of the previous statement 'He who is known as a perpetual renunciator'.

original: ata ekam apīty ādi ////
analyzed: atas ekam api iti ādi
translated: Therefore, 'one alone' etc.

original: baladevaḥ / yaḥ śreya etayor ekam iti tvadvākyaṃ ca na ghaṭata ity āha sāṃkhyeti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ yaḥ śreyaḥ etayoḥ ekam iti tvad vākyam ca na ghaṭate iti āha sāṃkhya iti
translated: Balarāma. Your statement 'which is better of the two' also does not hold, thus he says 'Sāṃkhya' etc.

original: jñānayogakarmayogau phalabhedāt pṛthagbhūtāv iti bālāḥ pravadanti /
analyzed: jñāna yoga karma yogau phala bhedāt pṛthak bhūtau iti bālāḥ pravadanti
translated: Fools say that the Yoga of Knowledge and the Yoga of Action are separate due to the difference in results.

original: na tu paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: na tu paṇḍitāḥ
translated: But not the wise.

original: ataeva ekam ity ādi phalam ātmāvalokalakṣaṇam ////
analyzed: ataeva ekam iti ādi phalam ātma avaloka lakṣaṇam
translated: For this very reason, the result is the vision of the Self, which is indicated by 'one alone' etc.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: yat sāṃkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṃ tad yogair api gamyate /
analyzed: yat sāṃkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānam tat yogaiḥ api gamyate
translated: The state that is attained by the Sāṃkhyas is also reached by the Yogis.

original: ekaṃ sāṃkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ////
analyzed: ekam sāṃkhyam ca yogam ca yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
translated: He who sees Sāṃkhya and Yoga as one, he sees correctly.

original: śrīdharaḥ / etad eva sphuṭayati yat sāṃkhyair iti /
analyzed: eva
translated: Sridhara: This is clarified by That which is attained by the Sankhyas...

original: sāṃkhyair jñānaniṣṭhaiḥ saṃnyāsibhir yat sthānaṃ mokṣākhyaṃ prakarṣeṇa sākṣād avāpyate /
analyzed: sāṃkhyaiḥ jñāna niṣṭhaiḥ saṃnyāsibhiḥ yat sthānam mokṣa ākhyam prakarṣeṇa sākṣāt avāpyate
translated: That place called liberation is directly attained by the Sankhyas, the ascetics who are devoted to knowledge.

original: yogair ity ārśa āditvān matvarthīyo 'cpratyayo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: yogaiḥ iti ārśaḥ ādi tvāt cpratyayaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: By the Yogis - the suffix ac should be seen as having the sense of the genitive, according to the rule beginning with arshad.

original: tena karmayogibhir api tad eva jñānadvāreṇa gamyate 'vāpyate /
analyzed: tena karma yogibhiḥ api tat eva jñāna dvāreṇa gamyate vā āpyate
translated: Therefore, that same [place] is reached by the Karma-yogis also through knowledge.

original: ataḥ sāṃkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca ekaphalatvena ekaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa eva samyak paśyati ////
analyzed: atas sāṃkhyam ca yogam ca eka phala tvena ekam yaḥ paśyati saḥ eva samyak paśyati
translated: Therefore, he who sees Sankhya and Yoga as one, as having the same result, he alone sees correctly.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: ekasyānuṣṭhānāt katham ubhayoḥ phalaṃ vindate tathāha yat sāṃkhyair iti /
analyzed: ekasya anuṣṭhānāt katham ubhayoḥ phalam vindate tathā āha yat sāṃkhyaiḥ iti
translated: How does one obtain the fruit of both by practicing one? He says, That which is attained by the Sankhyas...

original: sāṅkhyair jñānaniṣṭhaiḥ saṃnyāsibhir aihikakarmānuṣṭhānaśūnyatve 'pi prāgbhavīyakarmabhir
analyzed: sāṅkhyaiḥ jñāna niṣṭhaiḥ saṃnyāsibhiḥ aihika karma anuṣṭhāna śūnya tve pi prāgbhavīya karmabhiḥ
translated: By the Sankhyas, the ascetics devoted to knowledge, even though devoid of the performance of duties in this life,

original: eva saṃskṛtāntaḥkaraṇaiḥ śravaṇādipūrvikayā jñānaniṣṭhayā yat prasiddhaṃ sthānaṃ
analyzed: eva saṃskṛta antaḥkaraṇaiḥ śravaṇa ādi pūrvikayā jñāna niṣṭhayā yat prasiddham sthānam
translated: by those whose internal organs are purified by the duties performed in previous births, by the devotion to knowledge preceded by hearing etc., that place which is well-known,

original: tiṣṭhaty evāsmin na tu kadāpi cyavata iti vyutpattyā mokṣākhyaṃ prāpyata āvaraṇābhāvamātreṇa
analyzed: tiṣṭhati eva asmin na tu kadāpi cyavate iti vyutpattyā mokṣa ākhyam prāpyate āvaraṇa abhāva mātreṇa
translated: is attained, by the mere absence of obscuration, through the name liberation, by the Sankhyas, according to the derivation of the word as that in which one abides and never falls away from.

original: labhyata iva nityaprāptatvāt /
analyzed: labhyate iva nitya prāpta tvāt
translated: It is as if it is attained, because it is attained eternally.

original: yogair api bhagavadarpaṇabuddhyā phalābhisandhirāhityena kṛtāni karmāṇi śāstrīyāṇi yogās te yeṣāṃ santi te 'pi yogāḥ /
analyzed: yogaiḥ api bhagavat arpaṇa buddhyā phala abhisandhi rāhityena kṛtāni karmāṇi śāstrīyāṇi yogāḥ te yeṣām santi te pi yogāḥ
translated: Even those who have yoga, i.e., those who have the yogas, i.e., the scriptural actions, performed with the intention of the Lord's reflection and without the desire for results, are also yogis.

original: arśaāditvān matvarthīyo 'cpratyayaḥ /
analyzed: arśas ādi tvāt c pratyayaḥ
translated: The suffix 'ac' with the sense of possession is added because of the root 'arśa'.

original: tair yogibhir api sattvaśuddhyā saṃhyāsapūrvakaśravaṇādipuraḥsarayā jñānaniṣṭhayā vartamāne bhaviṣyati vā janmani sampatsyamānayā tat
analyzed: taiḥ yogibhiḥ api sattva śuddhyā saṃhyāsa pūrvaka śravaṇa ādi puraḥsarayā jñāna niṣṭhayā vartamāne bhaviṣyati vā janmani sampatsyamānayā tat
translated: Even by those yogis, by the purification of the mind, by the stage of knowledge preceded by meditation and preceded by hearing etc., either in the present birth or in the future birth, that

original: sthānaṃ gamyate /
analyzed: sthānam gamyate
translated: stage is attained by the stage of knowledge that will be accomplished.

original: ata ekaphalatvād ekaṃ
analyzed: atas eka phala tvāt ekam
translated: Therefore, because of having the same result, it is one.

original: sāṃkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca yaḥ paśyati sa eva samyak paśyati nānyaḥ /
analyzed: sāṃkhyam ca yogam ca yaḥ paśyati saḥ eva samyak paśyati na anyaḥ
translated: Only he who sees Sankhya and Yoga correctly sees, not anyone else.

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ yeṣāṃ saṃnyāsapūrvikā jñānaniṣṭhā dṛśyate teṣāṃ tayaiva liṅgena prāgjanmasu bhagavadarpitakarmaniṣṭhānumīyate /
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ yeṣām saṃnyāsa pūrvikā jñāna niṣṭhā dṛśyate teṣām tayā eva liṅgena prāc janmasu bhagavat arpita karma niṣṭhā anumīyate
translated: The meaning is this: In the case of those whose stage of knowledge is seen to be preceded by renunciation, by that very mark, the stage of action offered to the Lord in previous births is inferred.

original: kāraṇam antareṇa kāryotpattyayogāt / tad uktam
analyzed: kāraṇam antareṇa kārya utpatti ayogāt tat uktam
translated: Because it is not possible for an effect to arise without a cause. This is stated:

original: yāny ato 'nyāni janmāni teṣu nūnaṃ kṛtaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yāni atas nyāni janmāni teṣu nūnam kṛtam bhavet
translated: Those other births in which this is not done, in them it must have been done.

original: yat kṛtyaṃ puruṣeṇeha nānyathā brahmaṇi sthitiḥ // iti /
analyzed: yat kṛtyam puruṣeṇa iha na anyathā brahmaṇi sthitiḥ iti
translated: That which a person should do here, otherwise there is no abiding in Brahman.

original: evaṃ yeṣāṃ bhagavadarpitakarmaniṣṭhā dṛśyate teṣāṃ tayaiva liṅgena bhāvinī saṃnyāsapūrvajñānaniṣṭhānumīyate sāmagryāḥ kāryāvyabhicāritvāt
analyzed: evam yeṣām bhagavat arpita karma niṣṭhā dṛśyate teṣām tayā eva liṅgena bhāvinī saṃnyāsa pūrva jñāna niṣṭhā anumīyate sāmagryāḥ kārya avyabhicāri tvāt
translated: Thus, in the case of those who are seen to be devoted to actions offered to the Lord, by that very sign, their future devotion to knowledge preceded by renunciation is inferred, because the collection of causes is invariably concomitant with its effect.

original: tasmād ajñena mumukṣuṇāntaḥkaraṇaśuddhaye prathamaṃ karmayogo 'nuṣṭheyo na tu saṃnyāsaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt ajñena mumukṣuṇā antaḥkaraṇa śuddhaye prathamam karma yogaḥ nuṣṭheyaḥ na tu saṃnyāsaḥ
translated: Therefore, an ignorant person who desires liberation should first practice Karma-yoga for the purification of the internal organ, not renunciation.

original: sa tu vairāgyatīvratāyāṃ svayam eva bhaviṣyatīti ////
analyzed: sa tu vairāgya tīvra tāyām svayam eva bhaviṣyati iti
translated: But that will happen by itself when detachment becomes intense.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: etad eva spaṣṭayati yad iti /
analyzed: etat eva spaṣṭayati yat iti
translated: This is clarified by the word 'yat' (that).

original: sāṃkhyaiḥ sannyāsena yogair niṣkāmakarmaṇā /
analyzed: sāṃkhyaiḥ sannyāsena yogaiḥ niṣkāma karmaṇā
translated: By the Sankhyas through renunciation, by the Yogis through action without desire.

original: bahuvacanaṃ gauraveṇa /
analyzed: bahuvacanam gauraveṇa
translated: The plural is used for emphasis.

original: ataeva tad dvayaṃ pṛthagbhūtam api yo vivekenaikam eva paśyati sa paśyati /
analyzed: ataeva tat dvayam pṛthak bhūtam api yaḥ vivekena ekam eva paśyati sa paśyati
translated: Therefore, although those two are separate, he who sees them as one through discrimination, he sees.

original: cakṣuṣmān paṇḍita ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: cakṣuṣmān paṇḍitaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: he is wise, he has eyes.

original: baladevaḥ / etad viśadayati yad iti /
translated: Baladeva: This is clarified by the word 'yat' (that).

original: sāṃkhyair jñānayogibhir yogaiḥ niṣkāmakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: sāṃkhyaiḥ jñāna yogibhiḥ yogaiḥ niṣkāma karmabhiḥ
translated: By the Sankhyas, the yogis of knowledge, by the Yogis, by action without desire.

original: arśa ādy ac /
analyzed: arśaḥ ādi ac
translated: The suffix 'a' is added according to the rule beginning with 'arshad'.

original: sthānaṃ ātmāvalokalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: sthānam ātma avaloka lakṣaṇam
translated: The state is characterized by the realization of the Self.

original: ataeva tad dvayaṃ nivṛttipravṛttirūpatayā bhinnarūpam api phalaikyād ekaṃ yaḥ paśyati vetti /
analyzed: ataeva tat dvayam nivṛtti pravṛtti rūpa tayā bhinna rūpam api phala aikyāt ekam yaḥ paśyati vetti
translated: Therefore, he who sees, knows, that those two, though different in form as cessation and engagement, are one because of the oneness of the result.

original: sa paśyati sa cakṣuṣmān paṇḍita ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: sa paśyati sa cakṣuṣmān paṇḍitaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: He sees, and he is the one who has eyes, who is wise, is the meaning.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: saṃnyāsas tu mahābāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥ /
analyzed: saṃnyāsaḥ tu mahā bāho duḥkham āptum a yogataḥ
translated: But renunciation, O mighty-armed one, is difficult to attain without yoga.

original: yogayukto munir brahma nacireṇādhigacchati ////
analyzed: yoga yuktaḥ muniḥ brahma nacireṇa adhigacchati
translated: The sage who is united with yoga attains Brahman in no long time.

original: śrīdharaḥ / yadi karmayogino 'py antataḥ saṃnyāsenaiva jñānanisṭhā tarhy ādita eva saṃnyāsaḥ kartuṃ yukta iti manvānaṃ praty āha saṃnyāsa 🔽iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Sri Sridhara: If even the karma-yogis ultimately attain knowledge through renunciation, then it is proper to perform renunciation from the very beginning. In response to one who thinks this, it is said: renunciation.

original: ayogataḥ karmayogaṃ vinā saṃnyāso duḥkham āptum duḥkhahetuḥ /
analyzed: ayogataḥ karma yogam vinā saṃnyāsaḥ duḥkham āptum duḥkha hetuḥ
translated: Without yoga, renunciation is difficult to attain, it is the cause of suffering.

original: aśakya ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: aśakyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is impossible.

original: cittaśuddhyabhāvena jñānaniṣṭhāyā asambhavāt /
analyzed: citta śuddhi abhāvena jñāna niṣṭhāyāḥ asambhavāt
translated: Because knowledge-absorption is not possible without the purity of the mind.

original: yogayuktas tu śuddhacittatayā muniḥ saṃnyāsī bhūtvācireṇaiva brahmādhigacchati /
analyzed: yoga yuktaḥ tu śuddha citta tayā muniḥ saṃnyāsī bhūtvā acireṇa eva brahma adhigacchati
translated: But one who is united with yoga, becoming a sage, a renunciant, with a pure mind, attains Brahman in no long time.

original: aparokṣaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: a parokṣam jānāti
translated: He knows it through direct experience.

original: ataś cittaśuddheḥ prāk karmayoga eva saṃnyāsād viśiṣyata iti pūrvoktaṃ siddham /
analyzed: atas citta śuddheḥ prāk karma yogaḥ eva saṃnyāsāt viśiṣyate iti pūrva uktam siddham
translated: And therefore, it is established that before the purity of the mind, karma-yoga alone is superior to renunciation.

original: tad uktaṃ vārttikakṛdbhiḥ
analyzed: tat uktam vārttika kṛdbhiḥ
translated: That has been said by the authors of the Varttika:

original: pramādino bahiś cittāḥ piśunāḥ kalahotsukāḥ /
analyzed: pramādinaḥ bahis cittāḥ piśunāḥ kalaha utsukāḥ
translated: They are careless, their minds are outside, they are slanderers, eager for quarrels,

original: sannyāsino 'pi dṛśyante daivasandūṣitāśrayāḥ // iti ////
analyzed: sannyāsinaḥ pi dṛśyante daiva sandūṣita āśrayāḥ iti
translated: even the renunciates are seen to be defiled in their minds by fate.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: aśuddhāntaḥkaraṇenāpi saṃnyāsa eva prathamaṃ kuto na kriyate jñānaniṣṭhāhetutvena tasyāvaśakatvād iti cet tatrāha saṃnyāsa iti /
analyzed: aśuddha antaḥkaraṇena api saṃnyāsaḥ eva prathamam kutas na kriyate jñāna niṣṭhā hetu tvena tasya avaśaka tvāt iti ced tatra āha saṃnyāsaḥ iti
translated: If it is asked why renunciation is not first performed even by one with an impure mind, since it is necessary as the cause of the stage of knowledge, there it is said renunciation etc.

original: ayogato yogam antaḥkaraṇaśodhakaṃ śāstrīyaṃ karmāntareṇa haṭhād eva yaḥ kṛtaḥ saṃnyāsaḥ sa tu duḥkham āptum eva bhavati /
analyzed: ayogataḥ yogam antaḥkaraṇa śodhakam śāstrīyam karma antareṇa haṭhāt eva yaḥ kṛtaḥ saṃnyāsaḥ sa tu duḥkham āptum eva bhavati
translated: That renunciation which is performed by force alone, without the purifying action prescribed by the scriptures, which is not proper, that renunciation becomes only to be obtained with difficulty.

original: aśuddhāntaḥkaraṇatvena tatphalasya jñānanisṭhāyā asambhavāt /🔽śodhake ca karmaṇy anadhikārāt karmabrahmobhayabhraṣṭatvena paramasaṅkaṭāpatteḥ /
analyzed: śodhake ca karmaṇi anadhikārāt karma brahma ubhaya bhraṣṭa tvena parama saṅkaṭa āpatteḥ
translated: Because the fruit of that, the stage of knowledge, is not possible due to the impurity of the mind.🔽And because there is no eligibility for the purifying action, and because of the attainment of the highest danger by falling away from both action and Brahman.

original: karmayogayuktas tu śuddhāntaḥkaraṇatvān munir mananaśīlaḥ saṃnyāsī bhūtvā brahma
analyzed: karma yoga yuktaḥ tu śuddha antaḥkaraṇa tvāt muniḥ manana śīlaḥ saṃnyāsī bhūtvā brahma
translated: But one who is endowed with the yoga of action, being pure in mind, being a sage, being of a reflective nature, having become a renunciate, attains Brahman.

original: satyajñānādilakṣaṇam ātmānaṃ na cireṇa śīghram evādhigacchati sākṣātkaroti pratibandhakābhāvāt /
analyzed: satya jñāna ādi lakṣaṇam ātmānam na cireṇa śīghram eva adhigacchati sākṣātkaroti pratibandhaka abhāvāt
translated: He quickly, in no long time, attains, realizes, the Self which is characterized by Truth, Knowledge, etc., because there is no obstruction.

original: etac coktaṃ prāg eva
analyzed: etat ca uktam prāk eva
translated: And this has been stated earlier itself:

original: na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣkarmyaṃ puruṣo 'śnute /
analyzed: na karmaṇām anārambhāt naiṣkarmyam puruṣaḥ śnute
translated: Not by the non-performance of actions does a man attain inaction,

original: na ca saṃnyasanād eva siddhiṃ samadhigacchati // Gītā / iti /
analyzed: na ca saṃnyasanāt eva siddhim samadhigacchati gītāḥ iti
translated: nor by the renunciation of actions alone does he attain perfection. (Gita 4.16)

original: ata ekaphalatve 'pi karmasaṃnyāsāt karmayogo viśiṣyata iti yat prāg uktaṃ tad upapannam ////
analyzed: atas eka phala tve pi karma saṃnyāsāt karma yogaḥ viśiṣyate iti yat prāk uktam tat upapannam
translated: Therefore, even though they have the same result, it is reasonable what was said earlier that Karma-yoga is superior to the renunciation of actions.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: kintu samyakcittaśuddhim anirdhārayato jñāninaḥ saṃnyāso duḥkhadaḥ karmayogas tu sukhada eveti pūrvavyañjitam arthaṃ spaṣṭam evāha saṃnyāsas
analyzed: kintu samyak citta śuddhim a nirdhārayataḥ jñāninaḥ saṃnyāsaḥ duḥkha daḥ karmayogaḥ tu sukha daḥ evā iti pūrva vyañjitam artham spaṣṭam evā āha saṃnyāsaḥ
translated: But for a knower who does not ascertain perfect purification of the mind, renunciation is painful, while Karma-yoga is indeed pleasant. He clearly states the meaning that was previously suggested by saying Renunciation

original: tv iti /
analyzed: tu iti
translated: etc.

original: cittavaiguṇye satīti śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: citta vaiguṇye sati iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is when there is a defect in the mind.

original: ayogataḥ karmayogābhāvāc cittavaiguṇyapraśāmakakarmayogasya saṃnyāsiny abhāvāt tatra anadhikārād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ayogataḥ karmayoga abhāvāt citta vaiguṇya praśāmaka karmayogasya saṃnyāsini abhāvāt tatra anadhikārāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Because of non-yoga, due to the absence of Karma-yoga, there is no Karma-yoga that pacifies the defect in the mind in one who has renounced, because he is not qualified for that.

original: saṃnyāso duḥkham eva prāptuṃ bhavati /
analyzed: saṃnyāsaḥ duḥkham eva prāptum bhavati
translated: Renunciation becomes painful to attain.

original: tad uktaṃ vārttikakṛdbhiḥ
analyzed: tat uktam vārttika kṛdbhiḥ
translated: This has been stated by the authors of the Varttikas:

original: pramādino bahiś cittāḥ piśunāḥ kalahotsukāḥ /
analyzed: pramādinaḥ bahis cittāḥ piśunāḥ kalaha utsukāḥ
translated: Those who are negligent, whose minds are externally directed, who are slanderers, and who are eager for quarrels,

original: sannyāsino 'pi dṛśyante daivasandūṣitāśrayāḥ // iti /
analyzed: sannyāsinaḥ pi dṛśyante daiva sandūṣita āśrayāḥ iti
translated: are seen even among renunciates, their minds corrupted by fate.

original: śrutir api yadi na samuddharanti yatayo hṛdi kāmajaṭā iti /
analyzed: śrutiḥ api yadi na samuddharanti yatayaḥ hṛdi kāma jaṭāḥ iti
translated: And the Śruti says, If the ascetics do not extract from the heart the matted hair of desire.

original: bhagavatāpi yas tva saṃyataṣaḍvargaḥ BhP / / ity ādy uktam /
analyzed: bhagavatā api yaḥ tva saṃyata ṣaḍvargaḥ bhp iti ādi uktam
translated: And the Blessed Lord has said, But he whose six sense-faculties are well-controlled, etc.

original: tasmād yogayuktaḥ niṣkāmakarmavān munir jñānī san brahma śīghraṃ prāpnoti ////
analyzed: tasmāt yoga yuktaḥ niṣkāma karmavān muniḥ jñānī san brahma śīghram prāpnoti
translated: Therefore, the sage who is endowed with yoga, who is engaged in selfless action, who is a knower of the Self, quickly attains Brahman.

original: baladevaḥ / jñānayogasya duṣkaratvāt sukarakarmayogaḥ śreyān ity āha saṃnyāsas tv iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ jñāna yogasya duṣkara tvāt sukara karmayogaḥ śreyān iti āha saṃnyāsaḥ tu iti
translated: Balarama. Because the yoga of knowledge is difficult, the yoga of action, which is easy, is better, thus he says: Renunciation, however, is difficult to attain without the yoga of action.

original: saṃnyāsaḥ sarvendriyavyāpāravinivṛttirūpo jñānayogaḥ /
analyzed: saṃnyāsaḥ sarva indriya vyāpāra vinivṛtti rūpaḥ jñāna yogaḥ
translated: Renunciation is the yoga of knowledge, which is in the form of the cessation of all sense activities.

original: ayogataḥ karmayogaṃ vinā duḥkhaṃ prāptum bhavati /
analyzed: ayogataḥ karma yogam vinā duḥkham prāptum bhavati
translated: It is difficult to attain without the yoga of action.

original: duṣkaratvāt sapramādatvāc ca duḥkhahetur eva syād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: duṣkara tvāt sa pramāda tvāt ca duḥkha hetuḥ eva syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Because it is difficult and because it is accompanied by negligence, it would be a cause of suffering, is the meaning.

original: yogayuktaniṣkāmakarmī tu munir ātmamananaśīlaḥ sann acireṇa śīghram eva brahmādhigacchati ////
analyzed: yoga yukta niṣkāma karmī tu muniḥ ātma manana śīlaḥ san acireṇa śīghram eva brahma adhigacchati
translated: But the sage who is endowed with yoga, who is engaged in selfless action, who is devoted to contemplation of the Self, quickly, in a short time, attains Brahman.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: yogayukto viśuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ /
analyzed: yoga yuktaḥ viśuddha ātmā vijita ātmā jita indriyaḥ
translated: One who is endowed with yoga, whose mind is pure, who has conquered the self, who has conquered the senses,

original: sarvabhūtātmabhūtātmā kurvann api na lipyate ////
analyzed: sarva bhūta ātma bhūta ātmā kurvan api na lipyate
translated: Even while performing actions, he is not tainted, whose Self is the Self of all beings.

original: śrīdharaḥ / karmayogādikrameṇa brahmādhigame saty api taduparitanena karmaṇā bandhaḥ syād evety āśaṅkyāha yogayukta iti /
translated: Śrīdhara: Even though one attains Brahman through the sequence of Karma-yoga and so on, there would still be bondage due to the action that comes after that. Anticipating this doubt, he says one who is endowed with Yoga and so on.

original: yogena yuktaḥ /
analyzed: yogena yuktaḥ
translated: Endowed with Yoga.

original: ataeva viśuddha ātmā cittaṃ yasya saḥ /
analyzed: ataeva viśuddhaḥ ātmā cittam yasya saḥ
translated: And for that very reason, he whose Self, mind, is pure.

original: ataeva vijita ātmā śarīraṃ yena /
analyzed: ataeva vijitaḥ ātmā śarīram yena
translated: And for that very reason, he by whom the Self, body, is conquered.

original: ataeva jitānīndriyāṇi yena /
analyzed: atas eva jitāni indriyāṇi yena
translated: And for that very reason, he by whom the senses are conquered.

original: tataś ca sarveṣāṃ bhūtānām ātmabhūta ātmā yasya sa lokasaṅgrahārthaṃ svābhāvikaṃ vā karma kurvann api na lipyate ////
analyzed: tatas ca sarveṣām bhūtānām ātma bhūtaḥ ātmā yasya sa loka saṅgraha artham svābhāvikam vā karma kurvan api na lipyate
translated: And for that very reason, he whose Self is the Self of all beings, performs natural action for the sake of gathering people, even while performing action, is not tainted.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: nanu karmaṇo bandhahetutvād yogayukto munir brahmādhigacchatīty anupapannam ity ata āha yogayukta iti /
analyzed: nanu karmaṇaḥ bandha hetu tvāt yoga yuktaḥ muniḥ brahma adhigacchati iti anupapannam iti atas āha yoga yuktaḥ iti
translated: But since action is the cause of bondage, it is not proper to say that a sage endowed with Yoga attains Brahman. To this he says one who is endowed with Yoga and so on.

original: bhagavadarpaṇaphalābhisandhirāhityādiguṇayuktaṃ śāstrīyaṃ karma yoga ity ucyate /
analyzed: bhagavat arpaṇa phala abhisandhi rāhitya ādi guṇa yuktam śāstrīyam karma yogaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Action that is enjoined by the scriptures, endowed with qualities such as the absence of desire for the fruits of action that are reflected in the Lord, is called Yoga.

original: tena yogena yuktaḥ puruṣaḥ prathamaṃ viśuddhātmā viśuddho rajastamobhyām akaluṣita ātmāntaḥkaraṇarūpaṃ sattvaṃ yasya sa tathā /
analyzed: tena yogena yuktaḥ puruṣaḥ prathamam viśuddha ātmā viśuddhaḥ rajaḥ tamobhyām akaluṣitaḥ ātma antaḥkaraṇa rūpam sattvam yasya sa tathā
translated: The person who is endowed with that yoga, first of all, whose self is pure, whose mind is free from the impurities of passion and darkness, whose self is of the nature of sattva,

original: nirmalāntaḥkaraṇaḥ san vijitātmā svavaśīkṛtadehaḥ /
analyzed: nirmala antaḥkaraṇaḥ san vijita ātmā sva vaśīkṛta dehaḥ
translated: having a pure mind, having conquered the self, having brought the body under control,

original: tato jitendriyaḥ svavaśīkṛtasarvabāhyendriyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas jita indriyaḥ sva vaśīkṛta sarva bāhya indriyaḥ
translated: then having conquered the senses, having brought all the external senses under control,

original: etena manūktas tridaṇḍī kathitaḥ
analyzed: etena manu uktaḥ tridaṇḍī kathitaḥ
translated: by this, the one with three staffs as mentioned by Manu is described.

original: vāgdaṇḍo 'tha manodaṇḍaḥ kāyadaṇḍas tathaiva ca /
analyzed: manodaṇḍaḥ kāyadaṇḍaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The staff of speech, the staff of mind, and likewise the staff of body,

original: yasyaite nityatā daṇḍāḥ sa tridaṇḍīti kathyata // iti /
analyzed: yasya ete daṇḍāḥ sa tridaṇḍī iti kathyate iti
translated: he who always has these staffs is called the one with three staffs.

original: vāg iti bāhyendriyopalakṣaṇam /🔽etādṛśasya tattvajñānam avaśyaṃ bhavatīty āha sarvabhūtātmabhūtātmā sarvabhūta ātmabhūtaś cātmā svarūpaṃ yasya sa tathā /
analyzed: vāc iti bāhya indriya upalakṣaṇam  etādṛśasya tattva jñānam avaśyam bhavati iti āha sarva bhūta ātma bhūta ātmā sarva bhūtaḥ ātma bhūtaḥ ca ātmā svarūpam yasya sa tathā
translated: Speech is a metaphor for the external senses.

original: jaḍājaḍātmakaṃ sarva ātmamātraṃ paśyann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: jaḍa ajaḍa ātmakam sarvaḥ ātma mātram paśyan iti arthaḥ
translated: It is said that such a person necessarily has the knowledge of reality. He says: The self of all beings is the self, meaning he sees all things, which are of the nature of the conscious and the unconscious, as being of the nature of the self alone.

original: sarveṣāṃ bhūtānām ātmabhūta ātmā yasyeti vyākhyāne tu sarvabhūtātmety etāvataivārtahlābhād ātmabhūtety adhikaṃ syāt /
analyzed: sarveṣām bhūtānām ātma bhūtaḥ ātmā yasya iti vyākhyāne tu sarva bhūta ātmā iti etāvatā eva ārta hlābhāt ātma bhūtā iti adhikam syāt
translated: If it is explained that he whose self is the self of all beings, then since the meaning is already conveyed by just the self of all beings, the self of would be redundant.

original: sarvātmapadayor jaḍājaḍaparatve tu samañjasam /
translated: But if the words 'all-Self' and 'state' are taken to mean the conscious and the unconscious, then it is proper.

original: etādṛśaḥ paramārthadarśī kurvann api karmāṇi paradṛṣṭyā na lipyate taiḥ karmabhiḥ svadṛṣṭyā tadabhāvād ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ paramārtha darśī kurvan api karmāṇi para dṛṣṭyā na lipyate taiḥ karmabhiḥ sva dṛṣṭyā tad abhāvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: One who sees reality in this way, even while performing actions from the perspective of others, is not tainted by those actions from his own perspective, because he does not have that [taint].

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: kṛtenāpi karmaṇā jñāninas tasya na lepa ity āha yogeti /
analyzed: kṛtena api karmaṇā jñāninaḥ tasya na lepaḥ iti āha yoga iti
translated: Even though a knower of the Self performs actions, he is not tainted by them. This is stated by the word 'yoga' [in the verse].

original: yogayukto jñānī trividhaḥ viśuddhātmā vijitabuddhir ekaḥ /
analyzed: yoga yuktaḥ jñānī trividhaḥ viśuddha ātmā vijita buddhiḥ ekaḥ
translated: A knower of the Self is of three types: one is a pure-souled person whose mind is conquered.

original: vijitātmā viśuddhacitto dvitīyaḥ /
analyzed: vijita ātmā viśuddha cittaḥ dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second is a person whose self is conquered and whose mind is pure.

original: jitendriyas tṛtīya iti /
analyzed: jita indriyaḥ tṛtīyaḥ iti
translated: The third is a person whose senses are conquered.

original: pūrvapūrveṣāṃ sādhanatāratamyād utkarṣaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva pūrveṣām sādhana tāratamyāt utkarṣaḥ
translated: The superiority of the former is due to the increasing excellence of the means.

original: etādṛśe gṛhasthe tu sarve 'pi jīvā anurajyantīty āha sarveṣām api bhūtānām ātmabhūtaḥ premāspadībhūta ātmā deho yasya saḥ ////
analyzed: etādṛśe gṛhasthe tu sarve jīvāḥ anurajyanti iti āha sarveṣām api bhūtānām ātma bhūtaḥ prema āspadībhūtaḥ ātmā dehaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: But in such a householder, all living beings are attracted. This is stated by the word 'sarvesam' [in the verse]. He whose self, body, is the beloved of all beings.

original: baladevaḥ / īdṛśī mumukṣuḥ sarveṣāṃ preyān ity āha yogeti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ īdṛśī mumukṣuḥ sarveṣām preyān iti āha yoga iti
translated: Balarama. Such a seeker of liberation is the most beloved of all. This is stated by the word 'yoga' [in the verse].

original: yoge niṣkāme karmaṇi yukto nirataḥ /
analyzed: yoge niṣkāme karmaṇi yuktaḥ nirataḥ
translated: One who is engaged, devoted, in action for the sake of yoga, for the sake of liberation.

original: ataeva viśuddhātmā nirmalabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: ataeva viśuddha ātmā nirmala buddhiḥ
translated: And for that very reason, he is a pure-souled person, a person of spotless intelligence.
